intro: Porroglossum myosurotum, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite, lanceolate, and often covered in fine hairs. The fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature.
